instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG? PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG is a single phase of CPU VCORE before it is combined into PPVCORE_S0_CPU .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG? PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG Is a single phase of CPU VCORE for the graphics processor integrated into the CPU before it is combined into one PPVCORE_S0_AXG rail.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG: What is PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG? PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG is a power rail that powers the GPU in an S0 working state. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: Board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no video
threads.message:
Hello all,
This is my first post! Don't hesitate to tell me where I can improve.
So, I have a board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, with no video
- Green light on charger OK, I=1.85A with U=18.5V
- Fan spins OK
- Chime OK
- Backlight OK
- Grey screen also on external screen, but no image
- Mouse in USB: red light for 30 seconds, then off

Measuring - I put () for the theoretical values on the schematic:
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> (3.42V): 3.41
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (12.8V): 12.6

LCD:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL> (3.3V): 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_DDC_LCD</SIGNAL> (3.3V): 3.35
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> - <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> (50V): 30.2 (here I don't know why I have 30V instead of 40V or 50V as indicated on the schematics)

GPU rails:
<SIGNAL>PM_ALL_GPU_PGOOD</SIGNAL> (3.3V): 3.34
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GFX_REG</SIGNAL> / <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL> (1.0V): 0.91
PP1V5R1V35_GPU_REG (1.5V): 1.36
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0GPU_REG</SIGNAL> (1.05V): 1.06

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0GPU_FET</SIGNAL> (3.3V): 3.34
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_GPU_FET</SIGNAL> (1.8V): 1.84

Chipset rails:
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_REG</SIGNAL> (1.25V): 0.92
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG_REG</SIGNAL> (1.05V): 0.93
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_CPU_VCCDQ</SIGNAL> (1.5V): 1.5
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_CPU_VCCPQE</SIGNAL> (1.05V): 1.06
<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL> (0.9V): 0.81

All was ok here, so I tried around <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>:
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0_GMU_R</SIGNAL>: 3.33
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S0</SIGNAL>: 1.2
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>: 3.33
<SIGNAL>GMUX_S3_PD_EN</SIGNAL>:0
<SIGNAL>GMUX_S3_PD_GND</SIGNAL>:3.34
<SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>:3.33

So basically it seems that all powers are ok (except maybe for the backlight?), and I don't understand why I have no image. This can be GPU dead?

threads.title: Board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no video
threads.message:
Welcome to the forum!

If no internal, nor external video, usually GPU issue.


"Mouse in USB: red light for 30 seconds, then off"
Caps lock reacts after these 30s?

Any history available?

threads.title: Board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no video
threads.message:
Thanks!
Caps lock is faint green from the moment it chimes. It never disappears, stays always with the same intensity, pressed or not.
If I press caps lock (or ESC, or space bar) several times just after the mouse switches off (the 30s), red light appears for 3-4 seconds, then no reactions. If I wait 5 seconds after switch off, no way to have a red light again.
No history on this laptop, it comes from Ebay, but I don't see any water damage

threads.title: Board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no video
threads.message:
eBay boards are usually good for scrap.
I do not recommend to waste time.
However, if you have so much free time as me and others (these days) you can try known good BIOS.

threads.title: Board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no video
threads.message:
Thanks, I just want to go as far as I can, especially because I do not risk a lot with this board.
BIOS: this correspond to the "Boot ROM version", in the Hardware overview?
Is this contained in the EFI chip?
If yes I can replace the EFI chip with a good one from the exact same board reference, this would do?
I never did any BIOS flashing, so for the moment I would prefer to get a hardware fix (if any is possible)

threads.title: Board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no video
threads.message:
BIOS chip (<CHIP>U6100</CHIP>) from other board will have dirty ME region for your board.
In theory, should serve as test.
ME region can be cleaned at the end.
We should also have some link for clean BIOS on the forum...

threads.title: Board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no video
threads.message:
It works!!! Swaped the BIOS chip, and here is the blinking folder!! Wooow... Thanks for the idea!!!
Now I have 2 good boards and one chip :D
About cleaning ME region: no idea about that, is it mandatory in case of new BIOS chip? If the board passes AHT, would that be ok?
Otherwise I made some searches, it seems to exist simple ways, like here, with the possibility to get EFI firmware from Apple installation disk:
[url]https://github.com/corna/me_cleaner/issues/230[/url]
or other much complex (for me), here:
[url]https://ghostlyhaks.com/blog/apple-efi/25-clean-me-region[/url]
or this one that would require me one year study...
[url]https://www.win-raid.com/t1658f39-Guide-Clean-Dumped-Intel-Engine-CS-ME-CS-TXE-Regions-with-Data-Initialization.html[/url]
Do you recommend any trustful tutorial?

threads.title: Board <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mid 2012, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no video
threads.message:
Try this as is,
[url]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ZuJY52OtMPDNQ7qqa4HfS10zSgIuV59O[/url]
If works, then replace entire Fsys area from your backup...
